result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Craig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence the defendant is serving in other cases
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing to ensure abstinence
.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 144 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
State by Hynek / Def in custody w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
Amended Info filed
Stmt of Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
State has complied w/ Victim Notification
Ct 1 - Def pleads NO CONTEST
CRT finds def understands proceedings & finds def's plea is F&V made - factual basis exists to accept plea & finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 2 yrs Consecutive to the sentence the def is currently serving in other cases, w/ conditions:  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  No alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing to ensure abstinence & absolute sobriety;  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Credit for 144 days if probation is ever revoked
Status conference on June 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
